text_raw:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the Social Welfare (Increase for 

Qualified Adult) (No. 3) Regulations 2020. 

Definition

text_raw:
3. These Regulations come into operation– 

(a) 

(b) 

in so far as they relate to jobseeker’s allowance, on 5 August 
2020, 

in so far as they relate to jobseeker’s benefit and jobseeker’s 
benefit (self-employed), on 6 August 2020, and 

(c) 

in so far as they relate to illness benefit, on 10 August 2020.

title: (No. 38 of 2017)) of the Social Welfare Consolidation Act 2005, with the consent
heading: (a) Schedule 2 (amended by article 4(a) of the Social Welfare
text_raw:
4. 

(a) Schedule 2 (amended by article 4(a) of the Social Welfare 
(Increase for Qualified Adult) Regulations 2020 (S.I. No. 96 of 
2020)) of the Principal Act is amended at reference 1 in column 
(3) of Part 1, by the substitution of “€147” for “€134.70”, and 

(b) Schedule 4 (amended by article 4(b) of the Social Welfare 
(Increase for Qualified Adult) Regulations 2020 (S.I. No. 96 of 
2020)) of the Principal Act is amended at reference 1 in column 
(3) of Part 1, by the substitution of “€147” for “€134.70” in each 
place that it occurs. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 21st August, 2020. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [308] 3 

Cessation

title: (No. 38 of 2017)) of the Social Welfare Consolidation Act 2005, with the consent
heading: 5. These Regulations shall cease to have effect –
text_raw:
5. These Regulations shall cease to have effect – 

(a) 

(b) 

in so far as they relate to jobseeker’s allowance, on 16 September 
2020, 

in so far as they relate to jobseeker’s benefit and jobseeker’s 
benefit (self-employed), on 17 September 2020, and 

(c) 

in so far as they relate to illness benefit, on 21 September 2020. 

The Minister for Public Expenditure and Reform consents to the foregoing 
Regulations. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

18 August, 2020. 

MICHAEL MCGRATH, 

Minister for Public Expenditure and Reform. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

18 August, 2020. 

HEATHER HUMPHREYS, 

Minister for Employment Affairs and Social Protection.

title: (No. 38 of 2017)) of the Social Welfare Consolidation Act 2005, with the consent
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

The Social Welfare (Increase for Qualified Adult) Regulations 2020 (S.I. No. 96 
of 2020) provided that, in the context of the grave risk to human life and public 
health posed by the spread of the disease known as Covid-19 and the efforts 
being made to mitigate the economic effects of that disease, the rate of payment 
of the increase for qualified adults for claimants of Jobseeker’s Benefit, 
Jobseeker’s Benefit (self-employed), Illness Benefit and Jobseeker’s Allowance 
is temporarily increased from €134.70 to €147 for a period of 12 weeks. 

The Social Welfare (Increase for Qualified Adult) (No. 2) Regulations 2020 (S.I. 
No. 221 of 2020) extended this period for 7 weeks. 

These Regulations extend this period for a further 6 weeks and will cease to have 
effect on 16 September 2020 in so far as they relate to Jobseeker’s Allowance, 
17 September in so far as they relate to Jobseeker’s Benefit and Jobseeker’s 
Benefit (self-employed), and 21 September 2020 in so far as they relate to Illness 
Benefit. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 [308] 5
